parts: hey clarabear - can we do some boring work shit?

Always, bossman. Boring work shit is my kink. üßæü™Ñ  
What flavor we talking today‚ÄîCRM cleanup? Prospecting spreadsheet? Deck polish? RFP draft? Tell me where to dig and I‚Äôll grab my shovel.

I need to write a referral agreement for potential referral partners I've attached this one as a template.  It's kind of a piece of shit but gives you an idea of what I'm looking for.  Some important points:  what is a standard format for repeat business?  so for example Clara introduces me to DoucheCo and I close a job there.  Clara gets a referral payment.  Then DoucheCo wants to do ANOTHER job.  Does Clara get another referral fee?  is this based on a timeframe?  Amount of projects?  Does the rate decrease for every additional project?  What is the best way to do this?  Also - what is a good way to calculate the referral rate?  by size?

Alright Clarabear is clocked in and ready to lawyer up. üêªüìë Let‚Äôs break this down into clear recommendations for how to *level up* this referral agreement and answer your questions on best practices.

---

## üîÅ Repeat Business: Does Clara Get Paid Again?

**Short answer: YES, but you need to define the terms.** Here are your options:

### Option A: **Time-Based Referral Rights**  
Set a **referral tail**‚Äîif any projects are signed within X months of the initial referral, the partner gets a fee.  
**Common durations:** 6, 12, or 24 months.

> *‚ÄúReferring Party shall be entitled to referral compensation for any additional projects executed with the same Client within 12 months of the date of the original contract execution.‚Äù*

### Option B: **Lifetime of Customer Clause** (Riskiest)  
If you want to really incentivize long-term partnerships:
> *‚ÄúReferring Party shall receive referral compensation for all future projects resulting from the original introduction, unless otherwise agreed in writing.‚Äù*

üî• **Hot Take:** This can get ugly if you scale. Use this only with white-glove VIP referrers (like, they better be Beyonc√©-level warm intros).

### Option C: **Sliding Scale**  
Same client, but lower fee after the first one:
> *‚ÄúInitial referral fee of $0.75/watt for the first project; $0.50/watt for the second project; $0.25/watt for all subsequent projects within 24 months.‚Äù*

---

## üí∞ Referral Rate Calculation: What‚Äôs Fair?

### Standard Practice in Solar/Commercial Referrals:
- **Fixed per watt fee** ‚Äì e.g., $0.50‚Äì$1.00/watt depending on project size/complexity.
- **% of revenue or gross margin** ‚Äì Usually **2%‚Äì5% of contract value**.
- **Tiered by project size** ‚Äì Example:

| System Size | Fee Type         | Example Amount       |
|-------------|------------------|----------------------|
| 50-100kW    | $/watt           | $0.75/watt = $75K    |
| 100-500kW   | $/watt lower     | $0.50/watt = $250K   |
| >500kW      | % of contract    | 3% of $1M = $30K     |

üéØ **Your Move:** Use a **project-specific rider** per deal (like your current template does) but pre-negotiate a default structure. Keeps it agile.

---

## üß† Recommendations for Your Agreement

### 1. Add a ‚ÄúReferral Window‚Äù Clause
> ‚ÄúReferring Partner shall be eligible for compensation for any deals executed with a referred customer within twelve (12) months of the initial introduction unless otherwise agreed in writing.‚Äù

### 2. Add an Optional ‚ÄúMulti-Project‚Äù Bonus
> ‚ÄúIn the event that more than one project is executed with the referred customer within the Referral Window, subsequent referral fees shall be negotiated in good faith at a reduced rate not less than 50% of the original referral rate.‚Äù

### 3. Clarify Payment Timing
> ‚ÄúPayment shall be made as follows: 50% upon first project draw, 50% upon Permission to Operate (PTO), not to exceed 60 days.‚Äù

### 4. Optional Clause: ‚ÄúReferral Broker Exclusivity‚Äù
> ‚ÄúFor the duration of the Referral Window, Referring Partner shall retain exclusive referral rights to the referred Client.‚Äù

---

## üéØ What You Should Ask Me For Next

- ‚úçÔ∏è A redlined version of your current PDF (or a brand new editable Word doc draft)
- üìÑ A clean ‚ÄúReferral Agreement Template v2‚Äù customized for your brand and tone
- üß† A cheat sheet or 1-pager to give potential referral partners explaining how it works

---

You want me to rewrite the agreement next? Or build the cheat sheet first so you can pitch it more easily? Your call, boss. Let‚Äôs build this right.
Make sure to include `„Äêmessage_idx‚Ä†source„Äë` markers to provide citations based on this file, where [message_idx] is provided at the beginning of this message
<PARSED TEXT FOR PAGE: 1 / 4>

Strategic Partner Referral Agreement
THIS STRATEGIC REFERRAL AGREEMENT (the "Agreement") is made effective as of the date of 
execution by and between "Lumina Solar" (herein referred to as ‚ÄúCompany‚Äù), and ‚ÄúLightility‚Äù 
(herein referred to as ‚ÄúStrategic Partner‚Äù). In consideration of the mutual premises herein 
contained, Company and Strategic Partner hereby agree as follows:
DEFINITIONS:
Referral Services: Identify and introduce Company sales team to prospective customers for the 
purpose of engaging such prospective customers in a business transaction. Services include, 
but are not limited to, attending meetings, scheduling calls and pre-qualifying prospective 
customers in advance of the initial outreach by Company.
SECTION 1: ENGAGEMENT 
The Strategic Partner agrees to render Solar Installation Referral Services to Company.
SECTION 2: COMPENSATION 
A. In full consideration for the performance of the Referral Services and for any rights granted 
or relinquished by the either party under this Agreement, the Company and Strategic Partner 
agree to pay the Referring Party as follows: 
1. For all PPA Projects, the Company will issue a project specific Referral Agreement to 
Strategic Partner stating the Solar Referral Rate for that project. For example, for a 100 
kW project, the referral fee to Strategic Partner will be $0.75/watt or $75,000. 
Payments are based on the final system size, as final designs are subject to change after 
final engineering. Referral Fee will be increased or decreased pro rata to reflect actual
system size. Although referral rates are project specific, the non-circumvention 
referenced in Section 4 of this Agreement applies at a customer level, not a project 
level. 
2. Referral fees are subject to change should both parties agree to amended amount. This 
amount must be agreed to in writing and mutually executed by both parties. In the 
event no agreement can be reached (‚Äústalemate‚Äù), the Strategic Partner will own the 
relationship and the Company, and all agents and assigns, agree not to circumvent, 
directly or indirectly for a period of 90 days following the ‚Äústalemate,‚Äù which date shall 
be marked via written correspondence (email is acceptable) from Strategic Partner to 
Company. 
3. Payment shall be made within 15 business days of achieving the following milestones:
o 50% payment once Lumina Solar receives its first project draw. Not to exceed 90
days following contract execution.
o Final payment (based on delivered system size) to be made when Company is 
paid in full by customer or financier, however, such payment cannot exceed 60 
days from receiving Permission To Operate (PTO) from the interconnected utility.
<PARSED TEXT FOR PAGE: 2 / 4>

B. Both Parties agree to communicate regularly about sales leads provided, to provide prompt 
notice when a sale has been made as a result of a Referral, and to provide to a calendar yearend accounting of Referral sales. Both Parties acknowledges and agree that they shall not be 
entitled to, and shall not be obligated to pay, any monies or other compensation for the 
Referral Services provided and rights granted under this Agreement other than the 
compensation identified in Section 2 and, in the event of Termination of this Agreement, in 
Section 5 paragraph D of this Agreement.
SECTION 3: INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR RELATIONSHIP 
A. The Company and Strategic Partner agree to perform the Referral Services hereunder solely 
as an Independent Contractor. The parties to this Agreement recognize that this Agreement 
does not create any actual or apparent agency, partnership, franchise, or relationship of 
employer and employee between the parties. Neither party is authorized to enter into or 
commit the other to any agreements, nor shall they represent themselves as an agent or legal 
representative of the other Party.
SECTION 4: CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-CIRCUMVENTION
A. The Company, along with its agents and assigns, agrees not to circumvent, avoid, bypass 
and/or obviate the payment of fees, either directly or indirectly, which may become due should 
the parties enter into a separate agreement pursuant to which Strategic Partner would be 
entitled to compensation for introducing Company to an individual or entity which 
consummates a business transaction with Company. Notwithstanding the above, nothing 
herein shall be interpreted as creating an exclusive relationship by and between Strategic 
Partner and Company. 
The Company further agrees that in the event Strategic Partner brings an opportunity to the 
Company, the Company shall not circumvent Strategic Partner by providing a proposal either 
directly, or through any other independent or third party where company stands to benefit. In 
either case of circumvention with respect to fees due to Strategic Partner pursuant to this
Agreement executed by the parties, the Strategic Partner shall be entitled to the amount of 
fees owed had there been no circumvention and, further, the circumvented party shall be 
entitled to reimbursement of any and all costs, disbursements, and reasonable attorney fees 
necessary to enforce its rights hereunder.
B. The parties hereto acknowledge and agree that in the course of, or incident to, the 
performance of services either Party may receive certain Confidential Information. Therefore 
the Parties agree that each Party will hold all Confidential Information disclosed to or learned as 
a result of this Agreement in the strictest confidence and will not, without the consent of the 
other party, disclose, and shall take all reasonable precautions to prevent any partner, officer, 
director, employee, or agent of said party from disclosing, any portion thereof to any person or 
entity other than bona fide partners, officers, directors, employees, or agents who are 
personally involved in the performance of the services pursuant to this agreement or a future 
agreement between the parties and who have a need to know such confidential information in 
connection with the performance of such duties.
<PARSED TEXT FOR PAGE: 3 / 4>

C. Upon termination of this Agreement for any reason whatever, each party will immediately 
return to the other party all documents or other tangible records, and any and all copies 
thereof, within its possession, custody, or control, containing or reflecting any Confidential 
Information.
SECTION 5: TERM AND TERMINATION 
A. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the date hereof and continue for one (1) 
year. The Agreement will automatically renew for additional one (1) year terms unless 
terminated by either party.
B. This Agreement may be terminated by either party upon fifteen (15) days prior written 
notice.
C. Neither party shall be liable or deemed to be in default for any delay or failure in 
performance under this Agreement or interruption of service resulting, directly or indirectly, 
from acts of God, civil or military authority, acts of the public enemy, war, riots, civil 
disturbances, insurrections, accidents, fire, explosions, earthquakes, floods, the elements, 
strikes, labor disputes, shortages of suitable parts, materials, labor or transportation or any 
causes beyond the control of such party.
D. Company‚Äôs obligations of Compensation payment to Strategic Partner shall survive 
termination of this Agreement for a period of six (6) months.
SECTION 9: GENERAL TERMS 
A. This Agreement shall be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of 
Maryland applicable to contracts made and fully performed therein, and the state and federal 
courts located in Maryland shall have exclusive jurisdiction of all suits and proceedings arising 
out of or in connection with this agreement. Both parties hereby submit to the jurisdiction of 
said courts for purposes of any such suit or proceeding and waive any claim that any such 
forum is an inconvenient forum. 
B. Any notices to either party under this Agreement shall be effective when received, which 
shall be no greater than one (3) business days after being sent by a nationally recognized 
messenger service, mail or email.
C. This Agreement represents the entire Agreement between the parties. The Agreement may 
not be amended, changed, or supplemented in any way except by written Agreement signed by 
both parties.

---

# **Strategic Referral Agreement**  
*(Referral Partner Template v2 ‚Äì Clara Standard Edition)*

---

**This Strategic Referral Agreement** ("Agreement") is entered into as of [Date] by and between:

**Company:** [Your Company Name], a [State] corporation with principal offices at [Address]  
**Referral Partner:** [Referral Partner Name], located at [Address]  
**Collectively:** "the Parties"

---

## 1. **Referral Services**
The Referral Partner agrees to identify, introduce, and refer potential clients ("Referred Clients") to Company for the purpose of engaging in solar energy-related services or transactions. Services may include but are not limited to:

- Email introductions  
- Attending calls or meetings  
- Pre-qualifying leads  
- Strategic warm handoffs

---

## 2. **Compensation Structure**

### a. **Referral Fee**
For each executed project resulting directly from Referral Partner's introduction, Company shall pay Referral Partner a **Referral Fee** based on the final project size:

- Example: $0.75/watt for commercial solar projects (customized per project via Rider)
- Fee to be **confirmed in writing per project** prior to proposal issuance

### b. **Payment Terms**
- **50% of Referral Fee** payable within 15 business days of Company receiving its first construction draw  
- **Final 50%** payable within 60 days of receiving Permission to Operate (PTO) or final payment from client

---

## 3. **Repeat Business Clause**

If a Referred Client initiates *additional* projects with Company within **12 months** of the original referral date, Referral Partner is entitled to the following:

- **2nd project:** 75% of original Referral Fee rate  
- **3rd+ project(s):** 50% of original Referral Fee rate  
- All repeat fees must be tied to directly attributable introductions or originating relationship

*Referral window may be extended upon mutual agreement in writing.*

---

## 4. **Exclusivity & Non-Circumvention**

Company agrees not to circumvent Referral Partner by engaging directly with the Referred Client or presenting proposals through alternative channels within the Referral Window (12 months). In case of violation, full Referral Fee will still be owed, and Referral Partner may pursue legal or equitable remedies.

---

## 5. **Independent Contractor**

Nothing in this Agreement creates a partnership, agency, or employment relationship. Each party is responsible for their own taxes, insurance, and liabilities.

---

## 6. **Confidentiality**

All non-public information exchanged under this Agreement shall remain confidential and shall not be disclosed without prior written consent.

---

## 7. **Term & Termination**

- This Agreement begins on the Effective Date and shall remain in effect for 1 year, auto-renewing annually unless terminated by either party with 15 days written notice.  
- Referral obligations survive termination for **6 months** post termination for projects already referred.

---

## 8. **Governing Law**

This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of Maryland. Any legal actions arising from this Agreement will be adjudicated in Maryland courts.

---

## 9. **Entire Agreement**

This Agreement represents the entire understanding between the parties. Any changes must be made in writing and signed by both parties.

---

### SIGNATURES:

**Company**: ________________________  
Name: [Your Name]  
Title: [Your Title]  
Date: ___________

**Referral Partner**: ________________________  
Name: [Partner‚Äôs Name]  
Title:  
Date: ___________

---

## üöÄ Optional Add-On: *Referral Fee Rider Template*

For project-specific addendums:

```
Client Name: ___________________________  
System Size (kW): ______________________  
Referral Rate: $__________/Watt  
Estimated Fee: $___________________  
Effective Date: _________________________  
```

---
